required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Anti-interleukin 5 (IL5) Therapy on Sputum Cells and Cytokines

brief_summary.textblock: 22 asthmatics, in which mepolizumab was to be started, gave permission for inclusion and were followed up prospectively. Clinical and lung functional data, sputum analyses and cytokine measurements were analyzed.

primary_outcome.description: Bronchial airway inflammation. Differential cell count will be performed on sputum samples, determining eosinophilic (>3% eosinophils, <61% neutrophils), neutrophilic (<3% eosinophils and >61% neutrophils), pauci-granulocytic (<3% eosinophils and <61% neutrophils) and mixed granulocytic airway inflammation (>3% eosinophils and >61% neutrophils).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 seconds (FEV1)
primary_outcome.description: The forced expiratory Volume in 1 second will be measured using spirometry

secondary_outcome.description: Cytokines concentrations (pg/ml) will also be determined in sputum supernatant using a U-plex assay.
Cytokines concentrations (pg/ml) will also be determined in serum using a U-plex assay.

Asthma control will be determined using the Asthma Control Questionnaire (ACQ-6), including 6 questions. Each question will be scored from 0-6 and added together. This final score will be divided by the number of questions. If ACQ-6 < 0.75 = controlled asthma, ACQ-6 from 0.75-1.5 = partly controlled asthma and ACQ-6 > 1.5 = uncontrolled asthma.

Fraction exhaled Nitric Oxid (FeNO) will be used as biomarker for eosinophilic airway inflammation. FeNO < 25 ppb = eosinophilic inflammation less likely, FeNO between 25 and 50 ppm = need further interpretation with additional clinical information, FeNO > 50 ppm = indication of eosinophilic airway inflammation (according to the American Thoracic Society guidelines)

arm_group.description: Patients receive anti-IL5 treatment as part of their prescribed routine. Immunological and clinical parameters will be evaluated at the start of the treatment and after 6 months of treatment

intervention.description: Patients receive monthly injection with 100 mg mepolizumab

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- FEV1 < 80% in the last 12 months
- use of high dose inhaled corticosteroids (ICS) in combination with other additional medication or continuous use of oral corticosteroids (OCS)
- at least 2 exacerbations in the last 12 months
- at least 300 blood eosinophils/Âµl once in the last 12 months and at the time of inclusion
- Anti-IL5 treatment prescribed by the physician
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not completing all visits
